project_description: A comprehensive Flutter application for managing and viewing various bird species using the Cubit pattern for state management.
architecture_overview: The project follows a clean architecture approach, organizing code into different layers: data, domain, and presentation. State management is handled using the Cubit pattern to ensure a clear separation of concerns.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen : open
HomeScreen -> BirdCubit : fetchBirds
BirdCubit -> BirdState : emit(BirdLoading)
BirdCubit -> Repository : getBirds
Repository -> BirdCubit : List<Bird>
BirdCubit -> BirdState : emit(BirdLoaded)
HomeScreen -> BirdList : display(birds)
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. BirdCubit fetches the list of birds and emits states such as BirdLoading and BirdLoaded. The UI listens to these states and updates accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app starts with the HomeScreen, which displays a list of birds. Tapping on a bird navigates to the BirdDetailScreen to show details of the selected bird.
